level.heading: Conversions of foreign money in distribution proceeding.
level.text: The rate of exchange prevailing at or near the close of business on the day the distribution proceeding is initiated governs all exchanges of foreign money in a distribution proceeding. A foreign-money claimant in a distribution proceeding shall assert its claim in the named foreign money and show the amount of United States dollars resulting from a conversion as of the date the proceeding was initiated.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 11-85
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 11-85, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 15-901.

level.heading: Editor’s Notes
level.text: Uniform Law: This section is based upon § 8 of the Uniform Foreign-Money Claims Act.
